Comment.Text: Connection to the external application This box receives commands from the external stimulator application through the VRPN communication protocol.

SSVEP Training Controller You can configure the SSVEP training through this box. This box also configures the next Classifier Training scenario, so it is imperative to run this scenario every time you change settings in the training protocol. For more detail, please read the SSVEP Scenario documentation. Goal Sequence A sequence of space-separated numbers. Each number represents a flickering object to be marked as a target. The number 0 represents the No target as in staring to a blank space. Other numbers represent indexes of the previously defined frequencies. Stimulation duration The duration (in seconds) of the sequence during which the targets are flickering. Break duration Duration (in seconds) of a break, i.e.: the length of the period during which the objects on screen are not flickering. Flickering delay The delay (in seconds) between the moment when the arrow marking the target to be looked at by the subject appears and the beginning of the flickering sequence. Training Target size The size of a stimulating object on screen. The size is given as a proportion of the size of the window. Thus an object of size 0.5;0.5 would have dimensions of length equal to the half of the size of the shortest dimension of the window. Example of a value for this setting : 0.5;0.5 Training Targets' positions Positions of the targets on screen. There are N+1 targets on screen, where N is the number of stimulated frequencies. The first targets corresponds to the target number 0 which is not flickering at all. The values are given as relative positions to the screen. 0.0;0.0 represents the middle, 1.0;1.0 the top-right corner and -1.0;-1.0 the bottom-left corner. Example of a value for this setting : (0.0;0.0);(0.0;0.5);(-0.5;0.0);(0.5;0.0)

External Stimulator This SSVEP scenario needs to run along with an external application. The application is run automatically after the start of the scenario. The stimulator accepts two keyboard commands: Pressing <Space> will send a start stimulation to the scenario and the experiment will begin. Pressing <Escape> will quit the stimulator and stop the scenario.
Connection to the external application The external stimulator is controlled through VRPN to display the configured sequence of targets at desired moments.
You can browse each box' documentation by selecting the box and pressing F1

Scenario description This scenario is used for acquisition of the training data necessary to train the SSVEP classifiers. In order to run correctly it has to be configured by the SSVEP Training Controller box. For the detailed description and experimental protocol, please refer to the SSVEP Scenario documentation on the OpenViBE website. note: the recorded files go to the ${Path_Samples}/signals folder.
